name: transport, trolleybus | transport, trolleybus | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4572/documentation

Inventory refers to the entire transport life cycle. For road infrastructure, expenditures and environmental interventions due to construction of roads have been allocated based on the Gross tonne kilometre performance. Expenditures due to operation of the road infrastructure, as well as land use have been allocated based on the yearly vehicle kilometre performance. For the attribution of vehicle share to the transport performance a vehicle life time performance of 19’867’050 pkm/vehicle have been assumed. The energy use and combustion emissions dataset represents the energy use and combustion emission of a trolleybus in Switzerland.

 The energy use and combustion emissions service starts with electricity consumption.

operation of vehicle; production and maintenance of vehicles; construction of road. The energy use and combustion emissions service ends with the service of transporting 1 vehicle over 1 kilometre. The dataset includes electricity consumption, particulate emissions and until and including heavy metal emissions.
category: H:Transportation and storage/49:Land transport and transport via pipelines/492:Other land transport/4921:Urban and suburban passenger land transport

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data for gaseous emissions is based on scenarios for 2000.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data for vehicle operation and road infrastructure reflect Swiss conditions. Data for vehicle manufacturing and maintenance represents generic European data. Data for the vehicle disposal reflect Swiss situation. The data of the energy use and combustion emissions refers to average transport conditions in Switzerland.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: For vehicle operation all technologies are included in the average data. Road construction comprises bitumen and concrete roads. For the manufacturing of vehicles, the data reflects current modern technologies. For trolley buses no direct emissions due to combustion occur. However, emissions due to tyre, brake and road abrasion are accounted for.

exchanges.description: This input indicates the unit of road per vkm used during the transport activity. The road input is composed by two demand factors: - Road infrastructure and disposal (RI&D), which varies according to the gross vehicle weight. - Road operations & maintenance (RO&M), which does not vary according to the gross vehicle weight.
